    • Field Detail

      • GRID_SIZE_ROW

        private static final int GRID_SIZE_ROW
        This field represents the size of the row of the grid.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GRID_SIZE_COLUMN

        private static final int GRID_SIZE_COLUMN
        This field represents the size of the column of the grid.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RESERVED_ROOMS

        private static final int[][] RESERVED_ROOMS
        This field represents the area that surrounds the player's starting position. These areas are reserved, so that the ninjas do not spawn in these positions.

      • debugMode

        private boolean debugMode
        This field represents whether or not the Debug Mode is turned on.

      • user

        private Player user
        This field represents an instance of the Player class. In addition to this, the player's starting position is passed in as the argument.

      • specialRoom

        private Room[] specialRoom
        This field represents an array of instances of the Room class. There are nine rooms in the 9x9 grid. The instances of the Room class are only initialized, but not assigned positions.

      • goggle

        private Goggle goggle
        This field represents an instance of the Goggle class.

      • ninjas

        private Enemy[] ninjas
        This field represents an array of the Enemy class. There are six enemies that are created to be used in the game. The instances of the Enemy class are only initialized, but not assigned positions.

      • rand

        private java.util.Random rand
        This field represents an instance of the Random class. This will allow the Grid class to randomize the positions of objects' positions, such as the enemies, power-ups, and the briefcase location.

      • bullet

        private Bullet bullet
        This field represents an instance of the Bullet class. This class is assigned a null value initially. Once the player steps on the Bullet power-up, the class will be initialized and created.

      • invinc

        private Invincibility invinc
        This field represents an instance of the Invincibility class. This class is assigned a null value initially. Once the player steps on the Invincibility power-up, the class will be initialized and created.

      • radar

        private Radar radar
        This field represents an instance of the Radar class. This class is assigned a null value initially. Once the player steps on the Radar power-up, the class will be initialized and created.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Grid

        public Grid()
        This is the constructor of the Grid class. Once the Grid class is created and initialized in the Game Engine class, the Grid calls several methods to assign positions to the objects of the game, such as the rooms, ninjas, power-ups, and randomizes their positions.

    • Method Detail

      • createRooms

        private void createRooms()
        This method assigns positions of the rooms the briefcases can be located in on the grid. For every 3x3 grid, there is a room in the middle.

      • createNinjas

        private void createNinjas()
        This method initializes each instance of the Enemy class in the array. This sets the ninjas to be alive and assigns a default position of row and column position: (-1,-1).

      • createPowerUps

        private void createPowerUps()
        This method initializes each power-up in the game.

      • randomizeBriefcase

        public void randomizeBriefcase()
        This method randomly places the briefcase in one of the nine rooms.

      • randomizePowerups

        public void randomizePowerups()
        This method randomly assigns each power-up of the game a position on the grid.

      • randomizeEnemies

        public void randomizeEnemies()
        This method randomly assigns each ninja in the game a position on the grid.

      • setGogglePosition

        public void setGogglePosition(int firstRow,
                              int firstColumn,
                              int secondRow,
                              int secondColumn)
        This method receives the positions that the player looks in using the night vision goggles. The method will receive two positions, thus two rows and two columns, since the player looks in two spaces ahead of him/her. It then sets the goggle's positions to the positions passed into the parameter.
        Parameters:
        firstRow - the row of the first position the player looks in
        firstColumn - the column of the first position the player looks in
        secondRow - the row of the second position the player looks in
        secondColumn - the column of the second position the player looks in

      • getGoggle

        public boolean getGoggle()
        This method returns whether or not the night vision goggles are used.
        Returns:
        whether the Night Vision Goggles is on or off

      • goggleOn

        public void goggleOn()
        This method turns on the night vision goggles.

      • goggleOff

        public void goggleOff()
        This method turns off the night vision goggles.

      • checkRandomAvailability

        private boolean checkRandomAvailability(int row,
                                        int column)
        This method checks if a space is available/empty, so it can be used. A row and a column are passed in as parameter in order to check if the respective position is open or not. This method is used to determine whether or not an object or entity can be placed or moved there.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the position that is checked for availability
        column - the column of the position that is checked for availability
        Returns:
        whether or not the position is available

      • checkIsReserved

        private boolean checkIsReserved(int row,
                                int column)
        This method checks if the position that is passed in conflicts with the reserved spaces or not. This method prohibits ninjas from spawning to close to the starting position of the player.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the position that is checked
        column - the column of the position that is checked
        Returns:
        whether or not the position conflicts with a reserved space

      • checkIsPlayer

        private boolean checkIsPlayer(int row,
                              int column)
        This method checks if the position that is passed in is the same position as the player's position.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the position that is checked
        column - the column of the position that is checked
        Returns:
        whether or not the position that is passed in is the same as the player's position

      • checkIsBullet

        private boolean checkIsBullet(int row,
                              int column)
        This method checks if the position that is passed in the parameter is the same position as the bullet power-up's position.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the position that is checked
        column - the column of the position that is checked
        Returns:
        whether or not the position that is passed in is the same as the bullet power-up's position

      • checkIsInvinc

        private boolean checkIsInvinc(int row,
                              int column)
        This method checks if the position that is passed in the parameter is the same position as the invincibility power-up's position.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the position that is checked
        column - the column of the position that is checked
        Returns:
        whether or not the position that is passed in is the same as the invincibility power-up's position

      • checkIsRadar

        private boolean checkIsRadar(int row,
                             int column)
        This method checks if the position that is passed in the parameter is the same position as the radar power-up's position.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the position that is checked
        column - the column of the position that is checked
        Returns:
        whether or not the the passed in position is the same as the radar's position

      • checkIsEnemy

        private boolean checkIsEnemy(int row,
                             int column)
        This method checks if the passed in position is the same as one of the six ninja's positions
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the position that is checked
        column - the column of the position that is checked
        Returns:
        whether or not the passed in position is the same as one of the ninja's positions

      • checkIsRoom

        private boolean checkIsRoom(int row,
                            int column)
        This method checks if the passed in position is the same as one of the room's positions.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the position that is checked
        column - the column of the position that is checked
        Returns:
        whether or not the checked position is the same as one of the room's positions

      • checkIsBriefcaseRoom

        private boolean checkIsBriefcaseRoom(int row,
                                     int column)
        This method checks whether or not a position is the same as the room's position that contains the briefcase.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the position that is checked.
        column - the column of the position that is checked.
        Returns:
        whether or not the passed-in position is the same as the room's position that contains the briefcase

      • getDebugMode

        public boolean getDebugMode()
        This method returns whether or not debug mode is turned on.
        Returns:
        whether or not debug mode is turned on

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(boolean debugMode)
        This method is responsible for printing and creating the grid, based on the positions of each object or character. If debug mode is not on, then empty spaces will be printed as "dark" and will hide whatever is there, unless it is a room or a player. Additionally, if the player uses the night vision goggles, then this method will show the positions that are specified by the Goggle class. Also, if debug mode is on, then the position of every object and character in the game will be shown and not be hidden.
        Parameters:
        debugMode - whether or not the user has turned on debug mode or not
        Returns:
        the layout of the grid

      • checkGogglePosition

        public boolean checkGogglePosition(int i,
                                   int j)
        This method will check if a position is either one of the positions that are in the direction the player looked in using the night vision goggles.
        Parameters:
        i - the row of the position that is checked
        j - the column of the position that is checked
        Returns:
        whether or not the passed-in position is either one of the positions the player looked in using the night vision goggles

      • movePlayerUp

        public int movePlayerUp()
        This method checks if the player is able to move in the 'up' direction and moves him/her if permitted. Also, this method returns an integer, based on what is in the position that the player has moved in.
        Returns:
        integer based on what the player encountered or didn't encounter by moving up one position

      • movePlayerDown

        public int movePlayerDown()
        This method checks if the player is able to move in the 'down' direction and moves him/her if permitted. Also, this method returns an integer, based on what is in the position that the player has moved in.
        Returns:
        integer based on what the player encountered or didn't encounter by moving down one position

      • movePlayerLeft

        public int movePlayerLeft()
        This method checks if the player is able to move in the 'left' direction and moves him/her if permitted. Also, this method returns an integer, based on what is in the position that the player has moved in.
        Returns:
        integer based on what the player encountered or didn't encounter by moving left one position

      • movePlayerRight

        public int movePlayerRight()
        This method checks if the player is able to move in the 'right' direction and moves him/her if permitted. Also, this method returns an integer, based on what is in the position that the player has moved in.
        Returns:
        integer based on what the player encountered or didn't encounter by moving right one position

      • moveNinjaUp

        public void moveNinjaUp(Enemy ninja)
        This method checks if the ninja is able to move in the 'up' direction and moves the ninja if permitted.
        Parameters:
        ninja - the ninja that is being moved

      • moveNinjaDown

        public void moveNinjaDown(Enemy ninja)
        This method checks if the ninja is able to move in the 'down' direction and moves the ninja if permitted.
        Parameters:
        ninja - the ninja that is being moved

      • moveNinjaLeft

        public void moveNinjaLeft(Enemy ninja)
        This method checks if the ninja is able to move in the 'left' direction and moves the ninja if permitted.
        Parameters:
        ninja - the ninja that is being moved

      • moveNinjaRight

        public void moveNinjaRight(Enemy ninja)
        This method checks if the ninja is able to move in the 'right' direction and moves the ninja if permitted.
        Parameters:
        ninja - the ninja that is being moved

      • moveNinjas

        public boolean moveNinjas()
        This method runs a loop of the 'ninjas' array and checks if the player is near and if not, moves the ninja in a random direction in either up, down, left, or right. If a ninja is next to a player, then the ninja kills the player and moves in the position of the player.
        Returns:
        whether or not the player is killed

      • checkPlayerNear

        private boolean checkPlayerNear(int row,
                                int col)
        This method checks if a player is near the position that is passed in the parameter. If a player is near the position, then the method will return true.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the position that is passed in as the argument
        col - the column of the position that is passed in as the argument
        Returns:
        whether or not the player is near

      • getInvincTurns

        public int getInvincTurns()
        This method returns the amount of turns that the player is invincible for.
        Returns:
        amount of turns the player is invincible for

      • decreaseInvinc

        public void decreaseInvinc()
        This method reduces the amount of turns the player is invincible for by one.

      • checkInvincTurns

        public void checkInvincTurns()
        This method checks if the amount of the turns the player is invincible for is zero. IF it is zero, then the method turns of the invicibility power-up.

      • getAmmo

        public int getAmmo()
        This method returns the amount of ammunition left in the player's gun.
        Returns:
        the amount of ammunition in the player's gun

      • shootUp

        public boolean shootUp()
        This method is called when the player decides to shoot his/her gun in the 'up' direction. The method checks any ninjas are in the direction the player shoots in, and if there is, then the foremost ninja dies and the method returns true.
        Returns:
        whether or not a ninja dies.

      • shootDown

        public boolean shootDown()
        This method is called when the player decides to shoot his/her gun in the 'down' direction. The method checks any ninjas are in the direction the player shoots in, and if there is, then the foremost ninja dies and the method returns true.
        Returns:
        whether or not a ninja dies.

      • killEnemy

        public boolean killEnemy(int row,
                         int col)
        This method kills the ninja that shares the same position as the position that is passed in as the argument. If a ninja shares the same position, then the method return true.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the position that is passed in
        col - the column of the position that is passed in
        Returns:
        whether or not a ninja dies or not

      • shootLeft

        public boolean shootLeft()
        This method is called when the player decides to shoot his/her gun in the 'left' direction. The method checks any ninjas are in the direction the player shoots in, and if there is, then the foremost ninja dies and the method returns true.
        Returns:
        whether or not a ninja dies.

      • shootRight

        public boolean shootRight()
        This method is called when the player decides to shoot his/her gun in the 'right' direction. The method checks any ninjas are in the direction the player shoots in, and if there is, then the foremost ninja dies and the method returns true.
        Returns:
        whether or not a ninja dies.

      • setAmmo

        public void setAmmo(int bullet)
        This method sets the ammo count of the player's gun
        Parameters:
        bullet - number of bullets in the player's gun

      • getPlayerPositionRow

        public int getPlayerPositionRow()
        This method returns the player's position's row.
        Returns:
        the row of the position of the player

      • getPlayerPositionColumn

        public int getPlayerPositionColumn()
        This method returns the player's position's column.
        Returns:
        the column of the position of the player

      • getPlayerLives

        public int getPlayerLives()
        This method returns the amount of lives the player has.
        Returns:
        the amount of lives the player has
